text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Lebanese plane to Freetown to evacuate citizens.
- Bouez meets Syrian President Assad and Foreign Minister Shara in Damascus.
- Lebanon's balance of payments registers $564.5 million in first quarter of 1997.
- Lebanese bonds in Germany at $250 million mark.
- Israeli shelling of eastern and central sectors of south Lebanon. Guerrillas attack near Tallouseh inside the zone.
- Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce trades at record high on the Beirut Stock Exchange.
- Solidere shareholders' assemblies rescheduled for June 30.
- Hariri and Saudi prince laid foundation stone for $33 million hotel in Beirut.
- Lebanon public debt at 17,504 billion pounds end of March.
